name: Cream Cheese Pound Cake II
author: JOEBON
summary: This recipe is very moist and even when the cake is left in the oven a little too long, the cake stays moist on the inside. This pound cake freezes very well also. Wrap it in foil and freeze for up to 6 months.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease and flour a 10 inch Bundt pan
Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt
In a large bowl, cream butter, cream cheese, and sugar until light and fluffy
Beat in egg yolks one at a time
In a large glass or metal mixing bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form
Fold 1/3 of the whites into the batter, then quickly fold in remaining whites until no streaks remain
Fold the egg whites into the batter
Pour into greased and floured Bundt pan
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick comes out clean
